answers.answer: You also need to add weight control along with proper nutrition and daily exercise. Being at and/or lowering your existing weight to normal levels helps greatly to reduce high glucose levels. Can't say much about "one time a week it might go up 185" since you didn't tell us when you tested to see this result.These are the glucose levels and test times:Normal morning preprandial [b4 meal] fasting - 60/70 to 99 mg/dlPrediabetic is 100 to 125 mg/dlDiabetes is >126 mg/dlPostprandial [2-3 hours after meal] for diabetics <141 mg/dl, optimum <121 mg/dlHTH

question: Just. Wondering ...I dont take meds for type 2 I try to control by diet an exercise, one time a week it might go up 185....can I just exercise it down or will I need to get meds? What does my reading need to be in the morning
title: diabetes
